The only ocean view we got from our room was if we were standing and leaning over the bed to look out the high window... The window panels in the bathroom were not cut to fit the frame and allowed a constant draft into the room... not to mention the noise from the traffic and construction on the street... The towels we received were worn - literally had holes in them - and never received replacements that we requested... and the parking was extremely limited...

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here.”
Reviews.Author: Seyo
Reviews.Content: The Inn is located close to the airport, practically attached to railroad tracks, and next to a busy intersection. During our stay, we were entertained by loud planes late into the night, and very early in the morning. Trains passed by all night, reminiscent of the â€œBlues Brothers.â€� The car traffic from the airport noise was just as bad. This place is old, a relic from the "Spanish Inquisition." Our room was small and crammed. The children had to squeeze between walls and furniture to get around. The rooms are unkept. Our shower and bathroom door didnâ€™t shut completely. Also, we could hear the other roomâ€™s showers when they were being used. When this much water was being used, it sounded like heavy construction equipmentâ€¦very loud!! The A.C. made a lot of noise, but only provided cool air if you pressed your face up to the grill. They have placed a tiny safe into each room to which there is an additional $2.50 charge added on your bill, whether you use it or not. They claim it is a â€œvaluable serviceâ€� for you, but anyone could just walk out with this shoe box. They also charge you ahead of time $2.50 for two bottles of water that you are â€œgoing to drink,â€� although we didnâ€™t even have bottles in our room. There is free parking, if you can find one. There are only 17 tiny parking spaces for 29 rooms. One guest told me he had to walk nearly a mile from the motel to find parking. You would be crammed in with an ultra compact car the way they have the spaces marked. This fine establishment also offers a continental breakfast. A hazy glass jug of O.J., and some slabs of Wal-Mart bread still in their plastic container. The Spartans ate better!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here for heaven's sake”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't come here for the following reasons 1. The carpet is so filthy. I think it's never been vacuumed for a long time. 2. We caught 2 bedbugs 3. Some of the people in the area are suspicious looking. (maybe drug dealers, etc). One person checked-in for 1 week and said he's a constant occupant. 4. Restroom is dirty and have no exhaust fan. 5. The windows are not secured. anybody can just slide it and you'll get raped. I will never ever check in that motel again and I hope other people will be warned by my post about this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is that with in two minutes of walking into the room which was badly in need of repair and a good cleaing I walked right back out! I requested a refund and was denied and decided I would rather loose the $70 then to chance getting scabies from this place...so I left without a refund and went a stones throw away to the ComfortInn and paied only $8 more and was given a beautiful room that was clean and in good repair! Travlers beware! Stay away from this place at all costs is is not worth the money you save!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Horrible place! I made my reservation for a single room a month before going there (unfortunately!). When I reached the place, they first denied that they have a reservation. I was jet-lagged and with my baggage, and she finally asked me to wait for 3 hours before they can clean up a room. The staff were rude and misleading. The water wasn't draining through the sink! The room was dirty. Never had a worse experience at an inn or hotel in the US. Not worth a dollar paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place”
Reviews.Content: I waited about a month before a large convention before booking a room and this establishment was the only one near downtown with rooms available. That should have been a warning signâ€¦. I hate to admit it but I agreed to $219 a night for this place; When I arrived the manager tells me that they have no reservation for me. I present my e-mail confirmation, he looks in the computer and tells me that I cancelled this reservation two weeks ago I was in shock, I never cancelled this and I knew that there were literally no other rooms in town due to this convention. But wouldnâ€™t you know it, the manager informs me that he does have a room for me but the price is now $250 per night due to some nonsense explanation, half of which I think was in Hindu, about web agency rates and cancellation fees. What could I do? I was totally taken advantage of. Here I was 2,000 miles from home in a town with no other hotel rooms. I agree to the charge and got to my room. When I first walked in I wondered how that something like a modern chain hotel like Westin and this place can both be called the same thing. I think the fair market value of this room is about $29 a night. In fact I think I may have seen this same room on an episode of Cops. The place reeked of mildew. The carpet was disgusting, turning your socks black. The phone didnâ€™t work. The furniture was chipped and stained. An electrical outlet was missing its outlet and cover and had taped wiring exposed. The curtains had cigarette burns and were very stainedâ€¦how do stains get on curtains? I did have one lucky turn in that my room had two beds, that way I could replace the top sheet with the brown streak, grey stain and cigarette burns from one bed for the one from the other bed which just had cigarette burn holes. The beds themselves were rock hard and the pillowcases had the same problem as the sheets. The bathroom was quite bad; the whole thing was done in painted over mildew. Even the tile in the unlighted, scary shower stall was painted over and peeling off. The drain in the shower was just a hole, no drain cover. All the while, a six lane road with a never ending parade of vehicles is roaring by while the airport is literally a mile away and there is both a Amtrack line and a Trolley line running 100 yards behind the â€œhotelâ€�. The place was rumbling most of the time. Thankfully the rail lines seemed to not run between midnight and 7:00 am. I felt totally taken advantage of staying at this place. The management was impossible to communicate with and I could do nothing about it; I tried so hard to find another place during my four days here but the only thing I could find was 30 miles away in Carlsbad, CA. If you can tolerate dishonesty, filth, and noisy transportation going by all the time this place is for you; otherwise avoid it at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Rough but Fair”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nobody is perfect, and when you are booking a $100 per night hotel in San Diego you get what you pay for. The service isn't sterling, but it's not outwardly rude either. The Keepers are simply functional in their job duties so if you keep your expectations level you won't be dissapointed. The room was probably a bit below average. I'd measure it at about 10X15 and was very average in it's appointments. The bed was large and fairly comfortable, there was no microwave or coffee maker, but they did give me an iron and board for my entire 5 day stay. Basically the room was cramped but not uncomfortable. The location has it's ups and downs as well. Planes land less than a mile away and the train runs about 100 yards in the other direction. Pacific Blvd is never quiet and the neighborhood isn't upscale. That said - I never felt as though my sleep was interrupted or that I was in a particularly seedy part of town. The bottom line here is that if you book this place you have no business expecting top tier appointments and service. It's a $100 motel in San Diego. I enjoyed my stay knowing that the extra C-note per night was spent on enjoying my time in one of America's best cities.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff was rude on the phone and they hung up on me when I called to confirm my reservation (they reserved the wrong room type). In person, the staff was very unfriendly and cold. The room was badly in need of repairs. The smoke detector cover was missing and there was no battery attached. The list goes on. The only reason I stayed here was that the San Diego Marathon was going on and so there were no hotels available for 20 miles. In hindsight, I should have stayed 20 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: marcmalano
Reviews.Content: Our room was in serious need of renovation, had a strong stench of smoke even though it was a no smoking room, burns in the curtains and TV screen, and black mold almost covering the entire bathroom floor, extreemly tight parking, and train crossing nearby.

Reviews.Title: “And you call this a hotel???”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a visitor from Europe I've never seen a dump like this before. Outsmoked rooms, forgotten underware of the last run away guest in the closet, and a rude, cheating porter who rips you off your money ($145 a night) people beware, there are better and cheaper places to stay in SD. If you are suicidal this is the place to be, Noisy from the front by heavy trucks and from the back by amtrack (blow the whistle boy). Tear this place down please (I moved over to the Bristol hotel after the second night -- it was 3 stars better and cheaper)

Reviews.Title: “Disgusted”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a mold-smelling bathroom (an attempted paint job to cover it up on the bathroom ceiling), a large rusty ring aroung the bathtub drain, dingy white towels, a bathroom door that has to be slammed in order to close it, a desk chair that will fall apart when sat in, claims to have free phone calls which was advertised on their website, however, I was charged $0.50 per call, then this is it. I would NEVER recommend this establishment to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 week, good service and good location at a great price. Some noice from trains and street traffic. Close to marina, downtown, busses and trains.

Reviews.Title: “Good rates...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked through this website cos of the wonderfull rate, of 50 bucks for a night. Was cheapest available room in that area. The rooms are average, but great location, and cofee in the morning was a plus. Need more work. Other hotels on the same block were selling at 90 dollars or up, so i guess it wasnt a bad bargain if you wanna save a few bucks on the room and spend it on some other stuff. Housekeeping was above average. i spent 3 days and will go back if they give me the same good price.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Marina Inn for 3 days. It is very unfriendly, they have one of the worst and very rude front desk.Don't trust thier web site the photographs are not the actual room photos.Plus: 1. LocationMinus: 1. Unfriendly and unprofessoinal customer service 2. No common microwave (Charge $10 per day, if you request one) 3. Worst breakfast 4. Limited parking space 5. Chlorine smell in the roomsThe other good options near by are, 1. Holiday Inn Express (Marina Bay) 2. Marriott - Residence Inn 3. Days Inn

HotelInfo.Name: Marina Inn and Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 1943 Pacific Highway, San Diego, CA 92101
